alert.note: Alert for Adams; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 11:04AM EST until January 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... Wabash River near Linn Grove affecting Adams and Wells Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Williams, Fulton and Defiance Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River near Linn Grove. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Secondary roads are blocked. Roads near the east side of Geneva begin to flood. Some evacuations may be required and property needs to be transferred to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Thursday was 12.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 06/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
